long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Cannot place window in specific position any longer using --geometry
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
mate-terminal-1.14.1-2.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
mate-terminal --geometry=113x56-66+33 used to place the terminal window about halfway from left, now places it at top left.
This is the same issue I reported at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1369939 for xfce4-terminal.
mate-terminal --geometry=113x56-66+33 xwininfo
xwininfo: Please select the window about which you would like information by clicking the mouse in that window.
xwininfo: Window id: 0x4600beb "Terminal - ardy@daw3:~"
Absolute upper-left X: 5 Absolute upper-left Y: 55 Relative upper-left X: 5 Relative upper-left Y: 22 Width: 906 Height: 866 Depth: 24 Visual: 0xb5 Visual Class: TrueColor Border width: 0 Class: InputOutput Colormap: 0x4600006 (installed) Bit Gravity State: NorthWestGravity Window Gravity State: NorthWestGravity Backing Store State: NotUseful Save Under State: no Map State: IsViewable Override Redirect State: no Corners: +5+55 -1009+55 -1009-159 +5-159 -geometry 113x56+0+33
Steps to Reproduce: 1. mate-terminal --geometry=113x56-66+33 2. 3.
Actual results:
Window placed at top left.
Expected results:
Terminal window to be placed in position desired.
Additional info:
When I first experienced this problem with xfce4-terminal, I installed mate-terminal and modified my script to use it instead of xfce4-terminal to start multiple terminal windows in specific positions. This worked fine. When xfce4-terminal was patched, I reverted back to xfce4-terminal. I decided to test mate-terminal today and found it ignored positioning.
